description: {"blocks":[{"key":"4gaoj","text":"Methods for immunofluorescent staining of brain tissue with indwelling electrodes are described.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

funders.funder_name: Michael J. Fox Foundation for Parkinson’s Research (MJFF) and the Aligning Science Across Parkinson’s (ASAP) initiative
William N. and Bernice E. Bumpus Foundation

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"63vm","text":"Free floating 25-μm sections from rat A were rinsed three times for 5 min each with 0.01 M phosphate buffered saline with 0.2% Triton X-100 (PBS-Tx), and then blocked for 60 min in TSA Blocking reagent (Akoya science FP1012) diluted in PBS-Tx (TSA block) on a shaker.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1a80v","text":"Sections were left shaking for one night at 4°C in primary antibodies diluted in TSA block.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"97r9b","text":"Primary antibody and concentration used was: rabbit anti-MOR1(Abcam Ab134054, 1:500).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"20nn7","text":"Sections were rinsed three times for 5 min each with PBS-Tx and then were incubated in secondary antibodies diluted in TSA block for 2 hours on the shaker at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9rbl0","text":"Secondary antibodies and concentrations used were: goat anti-rat conjugated with AlexaFluor 546 (Invitrogen A-11081, 1:300), and goat anti-rabbit conjugated with AlexaFluor 647 (Invitrogen A-21245, 1:300).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1014l","text":"Sections were rinsed three times for 5 min in 0.1 M PB, then incubated for 2 min in DAPI (Invitrogen 62248, 1:1000) diluted in PBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4jam3","text":"After rinsing three times for 5 min in 0.1 M PB, all sections were mounted onto glass slides and cover slipped with ProLong Gold antifade reagent (Invitrogen, P36930).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cnmrm","text":"Slides were covered with aluminum foil and stored in 4°C until imaging.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6tbum","text":"100-μm sections on the glass slides from rat A were cover slipped without any staining with ProLong Gold antifade reagent.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"45j0g","text":"The 100-μm sections on the glass slides from rat B were rinsed three times for 5 min each with 0.01 M PBS-Tx, and blocked endogenous peroxidase activity with 3% H2O2 in PBS-Tx.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dpler","text":"After three times washing with PBS-Tx, slides were blocked in TSA block in the humidity-controlled chamber.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4h4vs","text":"After removing the excess liquid from slides, rabbit anti-MOR1 (Abcam Ab134054, 1:500) antibody diluted in TSA block was applied on the slides and slides were left for one night at 4°C in a humidity-controlled chamber.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"lddm","text":"Slides were then rinsed three times for 5 min each with PBS-Tx and were incubated with goat anti-rabbit antibody conjugated with polymer HRP (Thermofisher B40962) for 45 minutes at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c3a4s","text":"After rinsing three times for 5 min each with PBS-Tx, slides were incubated with TSA-Plus Fluorescein (PerkinElemer NEL745001KT) diluted at 1:100 in 1X Plus Amplification Diluent for 15 minutes at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6sdpn","text":"Slides were rinsed three times for 5 min in 0.1 M PB, then incubated for 2 min in DAPI (1:1000, Invitrogen 62248) diluted in PBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cq6ep","text":"After rinsing three times for 5 min in 0.1 M PB, slides were air dried, and then were cover slipped with ProLong Gold antifade reagent.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7oort","text":"Slides were covered with aluminum foil and stored at 4°C until imaging was done.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b4egl","text":"The TissueFAXS Whole Slide Scanning System (TissueGnostics) with x20 objective lens was used to obtain tiled-images from rat A.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bub22","text":"Cameras equipped with this system are Baumer HXG40c (HX series) CMOS camera 16 bit (2048 × 2048) for brightfield imaging and Hamamatsu Orca Flash 4.0 V2 cooled digital CMOS camera C11440-22CU for fluorescence imaging.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2kqr2","text":"Brightfield images were obtained from 100-μm sections to see carbon fibers left in the brains and fluorescence images were obtained from 25-μm sections to visualize MOR1 enriched striosome and endogenous rat IgG.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Immunohistochemistry for Carbon Fiber Thread Electrodes
title_html: Immunohistochemistry for Carbon Fiber Thread Electrodes

versions.title: Immunohistochemistry for Carbon Fiber Thread Electrodes
